intro: Diasperus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Diasperus fasciculatus is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
